intro: Pulicaria rajputanae, commonly known as the Rajputana groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of northern India. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant is typically low-growing, with hairy stems and narrow, gray-green leaves adapted to withstand dry conditions. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Pulicaria rajputanae is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is well-suited to xerophytic environments.
